content.html:
In this lesson, you will learn how to use the vertex form of a quadratic to determine the maximum or minimum value of a function and to solve problems.

When you finish this lesson, you will be able to:

  • Find the maximum or minimum of a function by writing the quadratic expression that defines it in vertex form.
  • Explain why the vertex is a maximum or minimum when given a quadratic function in vertex form.

Here are the activities that will help you reach those goals:

  • 9.9.1: Maximum and Minimum Value of a Function
  • 9.9.2: Does the Vertex Represent the Minimum or Maximum Value?
    • 9.9.2: Self Check
    • 9.9.2: Additional Resources
  • 9.9.3: Comparing Maximums between Quadratics
    • 9.9.3: Self Check
    • 9.9.3: Additional Resources
  • 9.9.4: Maximum, Minimum, and Analyzing the Vertex

After that, you'll practice and review.

  • 9.9.5: Practice
  • 9.9.6: Lesson Summary
